text: Bottle, 2015 edition. Pours opaque dark brown with small frothy beige head, wood-sweet bourbon aroma, medium carbonation, sweet roasted malt taste with strong bourbon and oak flavor, smooth body, long medium bitter woodsy taste. Very well rounded, smooth and tasty.

66cl Bottle sample at Potjepalooza. 2012 Vintage. Black colour, beige-brown head. Aroma of roast, soft and sweet bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, some rye. Sounds simple but it smells great. Flavour is medium sweet, some alcohol, dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak, rye, roasted malts, all very smooth and slick. Medium to full bodied, soft mouthfeel. Great.

Bottle @ Potjepalooza, 10 cl sample. 2012 vintage. Slight hazy copper color, short frothy head. Aroma of lots of raisin, incredible booze and some toffee. Raisiny sweetness and big boozy alcohol. Unrefined. Not my style.

Bottle, shared @ Potjepalooza.2012 version, pours black with a beige head. aroma contains a lot of bourbon, alcoholic, chocolate, roasted and toasted malts, vanilla, sweet. Taste of vanilla, bourbon, lots of dark chocolate, thick, roasted and toasted malts, cacao, thick body, long slightly peated finish, very nice.

Bottled, 2012 version. 10cl sample @ Potjepaloozas this-is-not-a-tickfest tickfest. The aroma has strong chocolate, vanilla, roast and booze. Black coloured beer with a thin beige head. The taste is light-moderate bitter and has vanilla sweetness, chocolate, booze. Medium-full bodied beer. Low-average carbonation. Nice.

Bottle, shared @ Potjepalooza, from an IP trade with richiesd. Black color.. Beige head, short retention. Aromas: bourbon, sweet, vanilla, chocolate. Retronasal theres bourbon, alcohol, sweetness, some chocolate, fruit. Flavor is rather sweet, bourbon, some berries. Alcoholfeel is quite (but not too) strong. Above medium bodied. Long finish, chocolate. Great stuff.

Shared from bottle at Potjepalooza. Black with light tan head. Sweet roasted dark malt, bourbon, vanilla, dark fudge, raisans, mocha. Big sweet and moderate bitter. Full body, very oily, low carbonation. Bit boozy but in a fitting way.

Bottle. Black pour. Aroma of delicious bourbon vanilla, milk chocolate, malt, booze and coffee. Flavor of milk chocolate, vanilla bourbon booze, creamy caramelised malt and a burning finish. Delicious.
22oz bottle pours a dark brown color with a bit of head. Rich bourbon spice and malt all deliciously balanced.
[2016] 22oz bottle. Black with a foamy tan head. Flavors are fudge, alcohol, bourbon, vanilla and molasses with fruity notes. Full body, soft carbonation, creamy texture.

Waxed bomber via trade. Poured a slightly opaque deep black with a smaller whkte foamy head. Aroma of chocolate pudding, pudding skins, bourbon, dark toast, yeasty. Flavor is the same plus a bit of yeasty. Solid body, thicker, average carbonation.

2016. Dark brown. Deep malts, molasses, chocolate, earth, light wood, Bourbon, citrus. Full bodied. Complex. Delicious. Might be Fremont best offering. Flavorfula dn interesting without too much booze heat.

Deep dark brown pour with a beige head that fades to a creamy ring. Aroma is raisin, bourbon, brown sugar, and sweet. Taste is bourbon, raisin, leather, sweet caramel, wood. Complex. Some boozy warmth. Full slick body. Really good. 2014 bottle.

2015 vintage. Trade with Sergiy, thanks man! Aroma: wow. Nose of caramel, lots of bourbon, vanilla and light molasses. Amazing smell. App: dark burgundy, small beige head, no retention. Taste and palate: medium body velvety and liquoreux at the same time, alcohol, moderate bitter and roasted finish. Overall: damn good. Honestly this beer classified in American Strong Ale I had no idea what to expect. It sure is more close to imperial stout than anything else. Love the nose and mouthfeel of this beer. Gotta love bourbon though because its really present. A great winter beer. Wish they would make smaller bottles of this beer especially with this high abv. Great beer.

Bomber received in a trade. This is a really dark beer, near black with a tan head. Kinda murky body. Huge bourbon aroma and very genuinely so with oaky nuances. Theres a little booze in the aroma along with leather, cacao, earth, and molasses. Mouthfeel is super full with just a touch of heat. Flavors of brownies, toffee, Raisinettes, chicory, vanilla, and again with the authentic bourbon barrel. This is a super complex, malty beer, not too roasty or too sweet just right in the middle.

Tap at the brewery. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma is massive bourbon Barrel: vanilla, caramel, also chocolate. Taste is the same, a full blown Bourbon Barrel Dark Ale, with lots of vanilla and caramel. Oily mouthfeel. Very good if you like Bourbon BA beers!

full tan head with good retention and minimal lacing. Pretty fuckin black brew. Nose is mild with whisky. Body is med/full, soft carbo, oily and slick. Gettin cinnamon and slight ginger notes, whisky and wood with a hint of vanilla. finish is a tad sweet and boozy. Props to my friend StefanSD for the bomber.

Near black pour, thumb sized puffy off-white head, rings of lacing. Dark fruit, bourbon, light chocolate notes in the aroma. Aroma is dark chocolate and roasted malt, strong bourbon notes, vanilla, dark fruit, toffee. Thicker body but incredibly smooth. 2014 Vintage

650ml bottle on Christmas. Vintage 2015. Pours an almost black with a strong dark beige head. Aroma is damn complex with lots of chocolate, bourbon, dark fruits. Same taste with boozy notes. Incredible! Must try beer!

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2016 Pours dark black with some brown head. Nose is bourbon, tobacco, fig, and raisin. Taste is toffee, raisin, with some tobacco. The barrel comes in near the back with bourbon and oak. Medium bodied, low carbonation, very creamy. Alcohol warmth on the finish. Outstanding. B-BOMB is the best thing Fremont produces, hands down.

Vintage 2015 Pours a darker cola flavor. Warming alcohol and a nice flavors of cinnamon, fig and winter spices. Little bit of vanilla. Surprised how muted the barrel flavors are at one year. Still pretty good though.

Really dark brown, almost black with a bit of mocha head. Aroma is huge. Lots of bourbon, dark fruits, dried figs, brown sugar, really complex. Taste is also really intense. Sweet and warning at first with bourbon, chocolate, dark fruits and finishes with butterscotch, creme brulee and earthy bitterness. Medium body with smooth mouthfeel and a hint of booze. Really complex beer, strong and intense.
Bottle @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Almost black pour with a decent light tan head. Tons of barrel notes, sweet vanilla, coconut, caramel, milky chocolate and sweet dark malts.

On tap at Hops & Pie as B.A Abominable, "Bourbon Barrel Aged Winter Ale". 14%, 65 IBUs. Black appearance with a brown head. Aroma of chocolate malt, oak, bourbon, light vanilla and a hint of caramel/toffee. Similar flavor, spicy, rich, malty, light woody flavor with bourbon barrel notes. Full body, pretty tasty overall.

2014 bottle poured into a tulip glass..opaque with a thin tan head..aroma of coffee
,bourbon,chocolate,winter spices..tastes like it smells..medium body..solid.

Dark brown to black colour, slight beige head. Aroma of vanilla, bourbon, raisins, crème brûlée and malts. Sweet flavour, vanilla, wood, raisins and caramel. Full body. Very sweet finish, malts, brown sugar and bourbon. Nice!(from 65cL bottle @ RBBSG IV, the Hot and Sweaty Edition, Gent 2015. I was under the impression it was 2013 vintage, but I see Tim and Ships are saying 14 and 15, respectively. Ah, well, well never know now.. Thanks for sharing, JefVerstraete!)

Bottle thanks to zakoon. Pours towards black with a beige head. Aroma of sweet bourbon, dark sweet fruits, caramel, toffee and slight bitter chocolate. Taste is sweet and syrupy, big bourbon notes, caramel, dark sweet fruits and ripe plums.

Pour pretty darn dark, as good as black, with a small light khaki head. 
Aroma has plenty of wet wood n bourbon. Chocolate, the vanilla,light roast, light ground coffee, slight chared oak, weak charcoal. Pretty nice and a whole lot of bourbon up in this bitch. 
Taste is pretty sweet, with a faint roasted bitterness. 
Medium and semi oily body, with a rather flat carbonation.

Bottle thanks to Zakoon. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aromas of huge bourbon, toast, dark fruits, vanilla, fudge, light smoke. Taste is fudgey, peppery spice, huge vanilla dates, raisins, sweet chocolate, light heat. Delicious!

Pours a dark brown color with khaki colored head. Caramel, bourbon, vanilla, oak, figs and nuts on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied. Finish with sweetness, bourbon, and some dark fruit notes.

August 5, 2015. Bottle, vintage 2014, @Sommarprovning, thanks for sharing!
Dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is caramel, bourbon, vanilla, charred oak, notes of milk chocolate, figs and notes of nuts and licorice. Taste is sweet, malty, slight boozy and some roasted bitter notes. Finish is sweet caramel, figs, vanilla, some bitter roasted notes, slight woody sharpness and warming bourbon. Medium to full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation. 
Nice, a bit hot with a slight sharp finish.
Bottle share @ DLD 2016. Pour is deep brown with a small tan head. Flavor and aroma of oak barrel, slight vanilla, molasses, toffee, dried fruit, and bourbon.

Bottle. Black with a medium khaki colored head that has fair retention. The aroma is big and bold with wood, a trace of spice, raisins, dates, plums and all manner of complex dark fruit. The taste is also wonderfully complex and features more dark fruit, cola, some whiskey, vanilla, oak, toffee, and dark fruits. The palate is full, smooth, a trace oily and very viscous. Finishes long and sweet. Overall: One of the best beers Ive had in a long time. At $13.00 a bottle it is also a fair value for a big beer. This to me tastes like what Westy 12 would taste like if you aged it a bourbon barrel.

22 Ounce bottle to wine glass from the brewery
Appearance: Dark amber/medium head/lacing
Aroma: very good aroma
Taste: Balanced
Mouthfeel: creamy
Overall:Very good beer

Drank December 26, 2015
Bottle from Craigs, dregs run. Pours dark brown with a thin beige head. Aromas of strong coconut, chocolate. Taste is more chocolate and coconut. Light boozy finish.
Bottle at craigs. Pours black, nose is toffee, coconut, chocolate, coffee, taste is similar, quite coconuty.

Bottle at home.. Dark black.. Thin tan lacing... Massive coconut bourbon roast malts nose.... Big chocolate roast.. Massive coconut.. Massive chocolate.. Big chocolate coconut roast malts... Dark roast

Poured a medium brown with a beige head
 Aroma was chocolat ed, caram er l, light hops and barrel. Flavor s imilar, chewy, big barrel.

Saturday night bottle share. Can courtesy of Syndicate. As if Abominable wasnt good enough, along come the BA variant. Extra smooth texture, hints of bourbon flash through the rich stout base. Nice well rounded brew made better with some bourbon barrel ageing.

On tap at prefunk boise. Pours out black topped with a small tan head. nose is great big bourbon barrel notes vanilla molasses sweetness. Taste is more of the heavy sweetness vanilla brown sugar big bourbon barrel notes.

Backlog 150806, thanks Angst for sharing!
This is a bourbon, toffee, sweet liqourice bomb! Nice alcohol to it. Really enjoyed it!

Our 1500th beer! A damn good beer, in our top ten. Pours a beautiful deep black with a tan head. Smells amazing, of bourbon, vanilla, dark fruit, chocolate and rye. Taste is super creamy, milk shake consistency, and very smooth. Lots of bourbon all around, with vanilla, plum and chocolate, with a warming booziness in the finish. Would be awesome with ice cream. Had in the bottle.
On tap at FOBAB 2015. Drunken writing in my program leads me to think it was quite bourbony but bitter. Also wrote varnish so must be harsh.
Bomber. Pours Black with thin tan head. Aroma is Bourbon, Chocolate and Vanilla. Taste is sweet chocolate bourbon with a alcohol bourbon sweet aftertaste. Delicious!

Bomber from Nirls. Sticker says $17.99. Pours a pretty thick black with a remarkably large sized tan head (for a non-bottle refermented barrel aged beer). Aromas of roast, oak, marshmallow. This might as well be an imperial stout. Taste is sweet and lightly bitter (malt bitter, not hop driven). Pretty substantial mouthfeel. Finished with a ton of bourbon barrel and brown sugar. Sheesh.

Bomber poured a clear dark redfish brown with a small lingering tan head. Aromas of bourbon, oak, cocoa and light roasted malt. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of milk chocolate, vanilla, oak and light bourbon with a smooth lingering chocolate finish.

22oz 2014 vintage bottle pours dark brown black with a finger of frothy dark brown head. The barrel treatment really brings the base beer to another level, lots of gooey marshmallow and vanilla spice added to the stout-like character of the base beer, some coconut, coupled with dark fruit, dark chocolate, bitter roast, and a nice layer of sweetness. Great.

Draft at the brewery. Very deep, dark brown pour with reddish tints and decent ivory head. Nose and flavor bring big caramel and molasses to the fore, with hints of roast, almond, fig, and vanilla rounding out the background. Bourbon is pronounced, but more rounded and seamless in its fitting into the beer as compared to this years BA Dark Star. Rich and sweet, but not overdone. Good stuff.
Sampled at Fobab. Pours black with a decent tan head. Aroma of bourbon and malt. Taste is bourbon, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, and some dark fruit. The bourbon tries to overwhelm. Very good.
On tap at FoBAB 2015. Murky dark brown pour. Aromas of dark fruits and vanilla. More old ale aromas than the coffee and cinnamon version. Boozy and delicious.

Pours a dark ruby red color that appears almost black and completely opaque in the glass with a one finger beige head that quickly settles into a thin, lasting ring. Streaks of soapy lace left behind. 

Strong barrel presence in the nose which is dominated by bourbon and a strong oak presence. Slight toothpick oaky character with a little bit of coconut, marshmallow and vanilla along with spicy and sweet bourbon notes. As it warms, Im picking up sweet and roasted malt as well as a bit of dark fruit. Hints of chocolate cake, fig, dark cherry and other vinous berries. 

Fuller end of medium bodied with soft carbonation. Really nice mouthfeel for the style. Thick but not viscous with surprising crisp carbonation that really helps. Again, the barrel presnce is really prominent with lots of bourbon flavor but its not hot or overly boozy. Sweet bourbon with some spicy rye along with dry, toasted oak, vanilla bean and some toasted coconut. After the beer warms, Im picking up more dark malt, spice and vinous fruit sweetness. A little peppery spice and rye compliment the spirit flavors. Theres also some cherry and other dark berries along with some silky chooclate sweetness and subtle roast. Still, this beer is a bit bourbon heavy but the lack of heat makes it pretty easy to drink.

2013 Vintage. Dark brown pour with a slightly guy white head. Big bourbon nose with a hint of spice. Caramel and toasted marshmallow. Really nice taste. Malty, just a hint of booze and a nice bourbon finish. Mild spice.

Enjoyed at Freetail Bottleshare 2015... Notes of dark chocolate, bourbon, roasted malts... Great beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared thanks to Zer0. Pours very dark brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of bourbon and woody barrel, vanilla, toffee, molasses, light chocolate, leather and some dark fruits. Flavour is light heavy sweet and light moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

33cl shared at October THT.
thin creamy tan head. Clear deep burgundy pour. Lovely barrel notes

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2015 Bottle at THT thanks to Zer0. Black with light brown head. Lots of bourbon, milk chocolate, light sweet coffee, dried berries and peach, light curry spices, vanilla, fresh cut wood. Quite sweet with light roasted bitter finish. Full bodied with soft carbonation and alcoholic finish. Very nice.

22 ounce bottle into snifter, 2013 vintage. Pours dense pitch black color with a small dense dark tan head with good retention, that reduces to a thin lace cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings around the glass, with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, molasses, toffee, raisin, plum, fig, cherry, vanilla, bourbon, toasted oak, leather, light licorice, and roast/oak earthiness. Fantastic aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt and bourbon barrel notes; with great strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, molasses, toffee, raisin, plum, fig, cherry, vanilla, bourbon, toasted oak, leather, light licorice, and roast/oak earthiness. Light amount of roasted bitterness and bourbon/oak spiciness; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, molasses, toffee, raisin, plum, fig, cherry, vanilla, bourbon, toasted oak, leather, and roast/oak earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roasted malt and bourbon barrel flavors; with a great roasted bitterness/sweetness and oak spiciness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light carbonation and very full bodied; with a very smooth, creamy, and fairly slick mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a small warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is an absolutely incredible barrel aged strong ale! All around fantastic balance, robustness, and complexity of dark/roasted malt and bourbon barrel flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. A highly amazing offering as expected.

Inky black pour with a thin light khaki head. Superb aroma of oak, chocolate, bourbon, brown sugar, vanilla, roast, a touch of molasses and maybe also a hint of cinnamon, sweet and chocolaty and bourbonny-woody. Smooth and velvety body with a creamy mouthfeel, loaded with oak, brown sugary bourbon, vanilla, deep sweet chocolate, and a little roast and molasses at the finish. Lovely body with lovely chocolaty blackness with lots of very smooth, very mellow oak and bourbon. Amazing.
Bottle - Dark roast, cocoa and chocolate notes. Jet brown with a light brown head. Sweet bourbon, coconut and a nice sweet chocolate finish. Bourbon sweet notes are great.

Bottle at a tasting at home. Black beer with an brownish head. Malty caramell Chocolate vanilla dark fruits aroma. Caramell woody dark fruits vanilla licorice chocolate flavour. A really nice beer :-)

On Tap at the Everett Craft Beer fest dark brown witha short lived beige hed. Teriffic warm sweet malty caramelized aromas and rich roasty flavors. The Burbon comes through nicely and is not over done. Very nice

Shortlived dark beige head over darker cola-coloured beer. Fine praliné chocolate, some herbs (lemonbalm? kafir lime?), roasted, vanilla, vanillacookies. Sweet-chocolate, herbal, alcohol. Again this praliné flavour. Very hot, full bodied, viscous. Another steroid brew - but the vanilla gives it a nice slant.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2015 Bomber received in trade. Thank you Bytemesis! Pours deep reddish brown with a rather small creamy goldenish beige head that leaves some sparse trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty with caramel, sweet dark bread, cereal, vanilla fudge, charred wood, chocolate covered raisins, toasted coconut, caramelised almonds, hay, moist soil and bourbon alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, malty and boozy. Mouthfeel is fat, oily, round, boozy and near full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, raisins, cherries in brandy, hay, moist soil and bourbon alcohol. Lovely malts drenched in bourbon. Tasty but waaay too hot!

Draught at Sommarprovning 2015-08-05. Opaque black beer with a small but lasting brownish head. Malty caramel aroma, raisins, toffee, caramel, chocolate, figs, vanilla notes, cocoa, some prunes. Woody caramel flavor, toffee, vinous, chocolate, cocoa, some licorice, warming alcohol. Very good.
Bottle 2014 vintage. Pours jet black with a minimal head. Aroma is boozysweet vinous dark fruits raisins malty. Flavor issweet boozy oddly spicy harsh roasted malts bitter ashy.

Sampled from bottle @ RBBSG 2015. Opaque pitch black color, small quickly diminishing brown head. Aroma is lovely: malts, dark malts, superb bourbon, vanilla and wood. Taste malts, vanilla, bourbon, dark malts, sweetish and bitter with a touch of alcohol. Oh man, this is lovely. Good body and carbonation. Love this.
Clear dark brown. Big vanilla and oak aroma. Creamy caramel, with strong vanilla, dark chocolate and bourbon flavours, alcohol warming but still quite easy to sip. Very nice!

4/VII/15 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle @ RBBSG IV - BB: n/a, 2014 vintage (2015-845)  Thanks to JefVerstraete for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown beer, creamy beige irregular head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: sweet, bourbon, vanilla, caramel, crème brûlée, sugary, very nice smell. MF: ok carbon, full body. Taste: very sweet, sugary, caramel, lots of vanilla, little sourish. Aftertaste: sugary, bourbon, caramel, sweet, some alcohol, crème brûlée.
Bottle from a trade. Many thanks! Soft carbonation. Very sweet and syrupy. Lots of bourbon and vanilla. Sweet. Good dessert beer, but a bit too boozy

Partagée avec Frank. Vintage 2014. Bière hivernale délicatement épicée qui flirte pas mal avec le stout impérial. Belle tenue de mousse et corps presque noir comme cette soirée avec quelques étoiles. Au nez, riches malts et bourbon caramélisé et vanillé, chocolat légèrement épicé, touche de réglisse. Le goût est assez doux mais pas trop sucré. Abondants malts caramélisés, choco, vanille, beau jeu du rôti, mélasse fruitée, vin dorge et impérial stout, bourbon boisé comme pacificateur. En bouche, le corps liquoreux est faiblement remué par les bulles. La finale est plutôt douce avec ce quil faut de chaleur et de rôti pour faciliter le tout.

2014 Bottle. Black pour retentice tan head with good lace that is punched down a bit by alcohol and glycerin. Nice barrel aroma; char and praline. Nice lactones, molasses and barrel. Aromas remind me of older viscosity. Viscous chewy mouthfeel, refined heat. Cocoa and ash. Char. Definitely older viscosity like but a bit sweeter and with more glycerin. Smooth, warming and slightly tannic. Light leather. Creamy carb. Really well done!

Dégustée au RBBSG 15. Cheers all! Bière brunâtre à mi chemin entre le stout, la BarleyWine et le Old Ale. Petite mousse en surface, allure vive, nerveuse et menaçante. Nez bien serré de réglisse, de bourbon et de canne à sucre. Ça sannonce lourd et riche. Le support malté que je remarque ici est imposant. Let the BarleyWine do the talking here! Ça sent et ça goûte les toasts. Bon, on parle bien de toasts au bourbon ici sur laquelle on tartine du caramel et du miel. Bien ronde, trop peu effervescente à mon goût mais sans arrière-goût et très bien balancée, jai beaucoup aimé cette bière, même si elle ne possède rien qui la distingue véritablement de ses consoeurs du même style.

Thanks to JefVerstraete! 655 ml. bottle sampled @ Hot & Sweaty RBBSG 2015. 2015 Version. Pours black with no head  way darker than I would expect from this style. Nose is thick bourbon with some light raisin, wood, light chocolate, touch spirit, chewy caramel malts, Taste is vanilla, sugar, light booze, thick caramel mixed with molasses, light coffee, syrupy, candy, exotic sugar, Thick & syrupy body. Not the best but highly satisfactory for sure.
Bottle at RBBSG, thanks for sharing JefVerstraete. Bourbon, chocolate, malts, warming. Good strong beer.

2011 Bottle. Pours a very dark brown with medium frothy tan head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is caramel, bourbon, wood, vanilla, roast. Thick mouthfeel, rich malt, nice roast, chocolate, boozy finish, chewy, really impressive.
Pours super dark, with a tan head. Rich carmelly notes of wood, bourbon, and vanilla added to dark roasty chocolaty malt flavor. Very complex yet still quite drinkable. Thumbs way up!
dark thick brown.. aroma is vanilla and rich toffee. taste is smooth with a nice toffee and bitter bite, smooth booze and light spice

Lighter on the barrel than the barrel aged dark star. Pours black with decent head and lacing. Roast and some nutmeg. Lots of caramel, and some other spices. A little on the syrupy side for my liking. Very sweet boozy finish. Tap at meridian pint.

4 oz pour on draft at Meridian Pint for the Founders/Fremont SAVOR event. Shared by solidfunk, thanks! Black with tan head. Aromas of bourbon, oak, chocolate. Tastes of bourbon, chocolate, oak, roast. Full body with a dry finish. Nice.

Enjoyed at an all barley wine tasting at Traviss house on February 21. We had the 2012 and 2013 vintages, this rating is the 2013). The pour is a nice dark black with a khaki ring of head and no lace. This pours almost like a stout. Really nice. The aroma is heavy on chocolate with an excellent bourbon note and a good vanilla. There is definitely some roasted malts and a healthy dose of caramel. The flavor is very similar. Some dark fruits poke through, followed by the chocolate malts, caramel, vanilla and a little molasses. The mouth feel is a tick lighter than Id like, with a soft carbonation thats great. Its just a good barley wine.

Pour is black with a good bit of camel colored head and some large bubbles. Nose is really nice, tons of rich wood and bourbon that melds well with a rich dark chocolate cake malt, a light roast, and a bit of caramel. Flavor is very rich up front, body is very full. Bourbon is a bit stronger, still has a lot of rich cake like malt, dark chocolate, faint roast but not as balanced as the nose. Back end thins on the flavor, gets a hint empty in back, some malt sweetness comes in as it warms. Nose is great, flavor falls a touch short, still very nice.
Bottle. Thanks Ferris. Pours dark brown tan head. Nose/taste of bourbon, wood, vanilla, cinnamon spices and chocolate - Full bodied.
Shared bottle. Pours black with a decent tan head. Aroma of bourbon and malt. Taste is bourbon, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, and some dark fruit. The bourbon tries to overwhelm. Very good.

Bottle, 2014, deep brown body, passes no light. Decent brown sugar colored head fades quick to a small ring. Aroma is vanilla, dark fruit, raisins, molasses, bourbon. Taste is raisin, molasses, vanilla, bourbon, a little metal, boozy, toasted barley and hops bitter finish. Palate is rich and thick, carbonation adequate, fairly soft. This is sweet throughout the middle, but dry and roasty at the finish. This is really great beer.

Sample, draught, during the Great American Beer Festival (Denver), savoured on October 4 2014; eye: black, opaque, tiny ring of mocha head, no lacing; nose: bourbon, woody, roasted barley, coffee, chocolate liqueur, toffee, light hops, alcohol; mouth: bourbon, woody, roasted barley, coffee, chocolate liqueur, toffee, light hops, alcohol, bittering hops, rich, alcohol warmth, light burnt barley, light acridness, finale in roasted barley with presence of chocolate, full body, below-average carbonation, surprisingly bitter, mildly sweet, liqueur-like texture; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS

Échantillon, en fût, lors du Great American Beer Festival (Denver), savourée le 4 octobre 2014; il : noire, opaque, petit anneau de mousse moka, pas de dentelle; nez : bourbon, boisé, orge torréfiée, café, liqueur de chocolat, toffee, léger houblon, alcool; bouche : bourbon, boisé, orge torréfiée, café, liqueur de chocolat, toffee, léger houblon, alcool, houblon amérisant, riche, chaleur dalcool, léger orge brûlée, légère âcreté, finale en orge torréfiée avec présence de chocolat, corsée, carbonatation sous la moyenne, curieusement amère, moyennement sucrée, texture liquoreuse; en résumé : très bon

Pours deep burnt umber with a finger of khaki foam. German chocolate cake in a glass with a shot of bourbon as a chaser ! Huge coconut, chocolate cake, bakers cocoa, roasted nuts and great soft bourbon character !

Poured from bottle to glass. Dark brown hue with creamy tan head that lingered. Aroma is toffee, vanilla, chocolate, toffee, caramel, oak. Mouthfeel is great with a full body and smooth carbonation. Taste is sweet with an astringent following and ethanol finish. Overall this is a great brew.

[2/28/15] Bottle sample at De Garde Brewing in Tillamook. Release and bottle share event. Black with a brown head. Aroma of chocolate, bourbon, soy sauce. Sweet flavor with chocolate, bourbon, a fruity note and a boozy note. Rounded and thick. Great.

Bottle care of Ryan, thanks man. Notes are heavy bourbon, wow! so rich with whiskey barrel, blackstrap, vanilla Rice Krispies. Rich and decadent. Notes of dark fruit as she opened herself up. Perfect amount of booze and warming quality. Awesome sipper. Cheers

2014. Dark black body, medium sized tan head, spotty lacing. Bold chocolate, roast, bourbon, oak, vanilla, fudge, and caramel. Full bodied, moderate carbonation, slick carbonation, mild booze, big finish.
Tap at Fremont Brewing, Seattle. Colour is black with small brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, chocolate, bourbon and roasted malts. Not overly bourboned.

Draft at GABBF, first beer of the fest: Poured an almost black with tan color head. Aroma was huge vanilla, stick bourbon and caramel malts. My mouth was filled with that amazing vanilla/bourbon mix, sweet caramel/chocolate malts, and nice strong alcohol. No wonder why it won the winter warmer award at the event, truly my highlight that weekend.
Bottle. Pours black with dark tan head. Aroma is sweet vanilla, figs, a touch of wood, caramel. Taste is rich, smooth, full-bodied, medium carbonation. Overall, this beer is absolutely delicious.

Bomber shared at home. Poured black with a dark tan head of foam that disapeared quickly. Aroma is rich with bourbon and alcohol. Taste is heavy sweetness, lots of malt and bourbon. Full bodied, sticky texture, lively carbonation. Very very good!
bottle, great beer. fuller bodied black pour. rich caarmel maltinesss, roasted malts, chocolate, vailla, wood, bourbon. Lots going on & it melted toghether very nicely.

Flight at brewery. As expected this is another unfathomally over the top booze barrel. Ugh, really cant even call it a sipper because its too off putting. Whatever happened to moderation, please 50/50 blend or something. At least it looks pretty.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Bomber shared by Levi - thanks! Very dark dense cola pour with a light beige head. Rich bourbon and vanilla. Licorice. Smooth rich palate. Killer brew!

2013 edition. 
Poured from a bomber into a Fremont goblet on 07.15.14.

A: Chocolate, licorice, red grape, and dark cherry. Wow!

A: Midnight black body with a little bit of red at the bottom of the glass. Slight tan head that fizzes and recedes to a ring.

T: Dark cherry, vanilla, and red grape dominate. Chocolate, slight woodiness, raisin, and spices are subtle.

P: Creamy smooth. Perfectly medium chewy.

O: This lives up to the hype. It has some alcohol heat, loads of dark fruit, and its perfectly balanced. I became a Fremont fanboy after this. Everyone has their own palate, but this one is at the top of the heap for me. Simply amazing!

Wonderful. Maybe a tad longer, a month or two in the cellar would add a little to it, but it is great now. Smooth dark ale. Nice balance of spice and bourbon. 

--- RATED

Bottle thanks to prufrockstar. Pour is deep brown to black with a medium brown head, lots if tiny velvet-like bubbles, reddish highlights. Aroma is a but spicy with some vanilla and a bit of booze. Taste is boozy at first but gives way to a caramel sweetness that is reminiscent of a whiskey drink, mixed with overly sweet coke. Finish is a bit warming and peppery. Overall, enjoyable and above average. I like the sticky sweet lip smacking finish without being a cloying mess.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2015 Served alongside Cinnamon & Coffee Bourbon Abominable. Near black body with a small beige collar. Rich aroma of bourbon and malts. Big time oak presence with lovely notes of both chocolate and vanilla. Absolutely delicious.

On draft at the brewery. Near black pour, with a small brown head. Creamy milk chocolate, toffee, lots of vanilla, strong bourbon, brownie batter, some toasted coconut, wood, and more bourbon. Lots of bourbon, but not boozy, smooth silky body. Yum.

Tap at Fremont - holy shit this is boozy - tastes like straight up bourbon - now, I love bourbon, but good god damn I ordered a beer - I am torn between my love of the brownest of the brown liquors and the need to evaluate this "beer"- oily texture - overpowering bourbon - sorry, "beer," but I must rate you poorly.

650 ml bottle. 2014 vintage. Pours black with moderate tan head. Aromas of bourbon, oak, and lots of alcohol. Flavors of same with additional coffee, dark caramel and dark chocolate notes. Very hot. Needs to cellar for a while.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2015 22 oz bottle carried back by Darrell, thank you sir. Pours a clear dark brown nearing black with light passing as rouge and dark lasting khaki head with sparse lacing. Aroma is intense bourbon and oak with vanilla, brown sugar, roast oak, anise, and a cinnamon complexity. Flavor is same, with medium body, muted carbonation and a whiskey char finish.

2013 Bottle. 
Strong vanilla, brown sugar, molasses. Alcohol booze too big. Chewy caramel delicious. Overall flavors are not cleanly pronounced, too much warming booze. Not worth the $20 price tag.

2013 Bottle sampled Dec 24, 2014
Pours a *very* deep brown with a tan head. Intense bourbon vanilla nose a bit of cinnamon and chocolate cake. Flavor is overly intense and boozy, tons of bourbon/vanilla oak, relatively sweet but with an almost sour twist that I dont much care for.  A bit of salt. Super-hot on the tongue, sticky. 

I bought this one after Kentucky Dark Star came out of nowhere to blow me away. But Im hugely disappointed here. Im not sure I can finish a snifter of this. Maybe my tastes have just completely diverged from the bigger-is-better crowd, but I dont see the point of beers like this. You cant even drink them.

tl;dr summaryThe usually excellent Fremont BOMBs on this one.

2013 vintage - Pours cola with a thin tan ring of head. Nose is real sharp and hot with sweet bourbon, molasses, and brown sugar. Boozy molasses taste with whiskey and brown sugar. Thick and slick with mellow carbonation.

2011 Vintage. Brown, not much head. Smells like bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, molasses...lots of rich decadent aroma. Thick, viscous palate, with a lot of the same flavors. Some subtle hop bitterness in the end. Really good, but I am certainly glad I had a bunch of friends to share it with...

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Bottle (22oz $16) Vintage 2014. Very dark brown with tan head. Bourbon and quite sweet to the taste. Need to update this rating with details.
Update 1/5/15: (was 3.8 now 4.0). Chocolate taste is very nice.  Initially tastes sweet, but it became more like bitter sweet chocolate as I drank more.

22oz bottle pours a viscous black with some cloudy, brown head. Nose has booze at first but opened up and had lots of charred wood, caramel, sour mash whiskey, toasted coconut. Flavor is a lot better, butterscotch, charcoal, a little dark whiskey, coconut, vanilla, cherry cola. Full bodied but smooth finish.

2013 bottle from Elise shared at Black Friday tasting. Caramel brown-black body, frothy beige head. Laces up the glass well. Bourbon, vanilla, touch of licorice. Very sweet, but balanced, quite nice. Chewy bourbon candy notes in the finish. Rich caramel, chocolate tones. Nice warming finish. World Class, really holds up. Solid beer.

2013 from Chucks Hop Shop for $17.99 last month. Deep ruby brown with a half finger brown head, creamy with fair retention. Big bourbon aroma, caramel and toffee. Some spicy alcohol and light roast, fading tobacco. Flavor big on the bourbon and heat, a bit of sherry. Otherwise follows suit. Still spicy and a bit hot. Bitterness is pretty low. Dry. Medium body with light carbonation. Damn good--rather, will be in a year. Still too hot. I am quite impressed with Fremont.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: bottle in a trade thanks to jeff!! shared with a friend. 2011 vintage!. dark brown pour with a creamy head. that sweet bourbon is in your face while pouring! roasted malts, vanilla, a lot of oak!, chocolate, dark chocolate, cacao, cinnamon, warm christmas spice like a verry small hint of anise, a lot of sweet settled bourbon, cant imagine what a bourbon bomb this needs to be when its fresh! remarkable beer! wasnt expecting this!
Pour from bottle, fobab 2014. Chocolate caramel and bourbon. Boozy, sweet, and malty. Thick and chewy. Pretty solid.
Dark pour with a bit of a cream head. Rich dark malt, mollasses and bourbon make up the lovely nose and taste profile of this amazing beer. Super impressed with this one.

Vintage 2012. Dark, dark, brown. Smells like a barrel-aged stout, roasty and boozy. Tastes more like a dark barleywine. Reminds me of Bourbon County Barleywine. This is really tasty. Sweet and rich. Feels a little syrupy.
Very bourbony. Chocolate fudgy soy bourbon.savory smell lot of sweetness. Decent, but cant finish sample though

Very dark brown in color, thin mocha head. Bourbon, chocolate, raisin, dates, vanilla, and cinnamon. Bittersweet with a little spiciness that grows more bitter and astringent in the finish. Smooth, full-bodied, and lightly carbed.
22 ounce red wax bottle. 2103 vintage. Big boozy bourbon nose. Very nice blend of bourbon and vanilla. Smooth and very tasty. Almost a lighter Dark Lord, but not by much.

Draught at a beer festival. Pours a near black color with a moderate tan head on there. Nose is very laden with bourbon and quite a bit of oak. Taste is slightly roasty, with some bourbon coming through as well. Nice and smooth. Glad I was able to catch this.

Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Aromas of vanilla, oak, caramel, some fig, honey maybe. Taste has a slight holiday spice and then nice vanilla, oak, honey notes. Hint of cocoa maybe. Nice full body.

2013 bottle shared by Puddintane. Thanks Pud! Darkest brown pour with a medium tan head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla and chocolate. Malty and chocolatey flavor with vanilla character before a roasty finish.
Bottle shared with Timfooley. Gotta the the BB beers. Full bodied beer, with hints of chocolate and SMG. Good stuff.

Rating this from memory, but this is probably a top #3 barrel aged beer for me. Tons of body, very smooth creamy, thick body with notes of cocoa, dark chocolate, Christmas cake, and lots of bourbon. Sweet, but never cloying. Perfectly rounded. Superb.
UPDATED: JUL 7, 2015 on tap. dark brown some tan head. Aroma of soy sauce, coffee liquor. tastes of coffee, berries, butterscotch. Creamy dry palate. Awesome and intense.
On tap at Fredfest 2014. Pours near black with a modest tan head and a treacle and bourbon aroma. There is a rich dark molasses flavor with lots of vanilla and bourbon. Very tasty.
22oz bottle. 2012 vintage. Poured a dark brown color with an off white head. Bourbon, vanilla, roast, chocolate, and caramel.

2012 maroon wax top bottle shared at the RBNG by Phatdog1. Awesome aroma of cocoa, roasted malt, cinnamon, vanilla, dark fruits with a beautiful bourbon barrel oak on top all of those aromas. 
Flavor is just as rich and lives up to the aroma! Deep elegant bourbon notes ingrained with the rich dark chocolate, graham cracker, coffee beans, and a little wood/oak character in the backend. hints of spice in here as well. 
Overall this Barrel aged Strong Ale drinks like an imperial stout. Body is thick and creamy with a velvet smooth character. I feel like I need to take a flight out to Seattle. This brewery produces really wonderful barrel aged brews.

2012 Vintage

A - Incredibly dark black oily, smooth light head.

S - Whoa. holy chocolate bomb, cinnamon and spices. a lot of awesomeness on this nose.

T - Holy more chocolate! Wow. Tastes amazing. Super roasty. Just like a dessert of christmas spices

M - Silky smooth. sweet and full of flavor. 

O - This is amazing. Not as great as KDS but still remarkable.
2013 vintage, pours brown with a thin off white head. Aroma of sweet malt, brown sugar, molasses and vanilla. Taste is bourbon, oak, vanilla and caramel. Hot but still really tasty.
Draft pour. Pours dark with strong Bourbon aroma. Complex flavors with vanilla wafer and butterscotch. Sweet, smooth finish. Great beer.

2012 bottle from an IP trade in Seattle but I cant remember who. Dark brown with a nice brown head that mostly fades. Vanilla, butterscotch, bourbon, vanilla, light oak, smooth. Mild carbonation and moderate body, boozy and sweet, some toffee.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2014 Bottle: Very deep brown, almost appearing black with a light-tan colored head that swiftly wafts away into nothing. Aroma full of bourbon, oak, & an underlying, spicy vanillin-woody sweetness. Lighter undercurrent of cocoa dust, toasted caramel, & sticky molasses. Taste is packed with creamy, silky bourbon, almost more on the sweet side & not very hard (good thing). Plums, black cherries, molasses, caramel, maple syrup, & burnt brown sugar round out the flavor profile, leading into a heavier wood, bourbon, & vanilla finish. Lightly spicy from the barrel... Though the booze is certainly present, it remains dangerously drinkable thanks to a nice, balancing sweetness. Very nice ale.
bottle pours deep amber, ample khaki head. nose is full of bourbon and booze. chocolate, caramel, vanilla, with a solid bourbon finish. full body, creamy. high boost. luv it.
Bottle. Black pour with brown head. Super bourbon aromas, some light spices. Flavor is bourbon heavy, some chocolate and caramel but no spice left.

From notes. Bottle share courtesy of Bytemesis. Thank you! Huge aromas and flavors of vanilla, nuttiness, toasted coconut, caramelized sugar, creame brûlée, creamy chocolate and BROWNIES!!! Tons of Bourbon Barrel-Aged character. I love this style! Full bodied, rich and creamy, with lower carbonation. In comparison, sweeter and richer then Kentucky Dark Star. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

65cl, Vintage 2011, at 9.5%Vol, as Bourbon Abominable, exclusive American brew, thx to Secret Santa!, very complex brew, alcoholic/roasted and slightly woody/spicy, yet not too heavy, balanced, hazy, nearly no head, very good Winter brew, yet very expensive!

Pours a really murky, cloudy, and really dark brown color with a nice bubbly brown head. Good bit of bourbon and alcohol on the nose, lots of vanilla and caramel, milky chocolate, some dark fruits, and a subtle hint of spice. Wow, tons of bourbon oakiness and vanilla on the taste, dark chocolate, roasted malt, and a bit of molasses. Super tasty, smooth and creamy. Definitely a bourbon bomb. Id love to see what a few years does to this beer.

Bottle with thanks to Prufrockstar! Pours cloudy mahogany with a small tan head and decent lacing. Aroma is a nice blend of bourbon, dark sugars, raisin, cocoa and vanilla. Flavor is the same, medium sweet and light bitter with notes of bourbon, molasses and vanilla. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Light woody astringency, some heat from the ABV. Pretty darn nice beer.
Dark brown-black, no foam. Rich dark ale aroma, cherry, fig, wood, alcohol. Taste is rich chocolate liquor, cherry, char and ash. Boozy but not overwhelming. Terrific.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2014 Pours jet black with small beige head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, bourbon, and prunes. Taste huge dark chocolate and coffee. Toffee, vanilla, cotton candy, bourbon. Finishes sweet. Mouthfeel is velvety and thick - yum! Very similar, but better than Bourbon County Stout, which I love! This beer is amazing!
Black no head. Drinking both 11 and 12. 11 is a bit bland, cola and coffee. 12 is a better. Some roast and toffee.
Very reminiscent of Goose Island Bourbon County Stout. I would recommend this beer to any beer lover.

Bottle, 2012 vintage. Dark brown pour. Boozy nose, notes of vanilla, bourbon and chocolate. Boozy, funky flavour, lots of chocolate and vanilla. Extremely tasty - almost mistook it for an imperial stout.

Bottle thanks to Lizzy and Daren! Pours a very dark brown with a creamy brown head that lasts throughout the beer. Aroma has a strong booze and bourbon note with molasses and caramel underlying. Flavor starts with some darker grains and molasses with a growing boozy and bourbon note through the finish as well as a touch of roast..

2012 Vintage
Deep brown/black with a tan head. Aroma is bourbon, wood, chocolate. Oily mouthfeel, sweet on the palate, slightly boozy finish. Taste is chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, wood.

2011 Vintage
Very dark with a small pale head. Aroma is chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, caramel, spices. Slightly sticky mouthfeel, nice balance on the palate. Taste is chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, dark fruit, cookie. 

2010 Vintage
Rusty brown with virtually no head. Aroma is raisins, dates, brown sugar, bourbon, vanilla. Smooth on the palate with a hint of booze in the finish. Taste is vanilla, Speculoos, brown sugar, dark fruits.

bomber shared. poured opaque brown to almost black. mild carbonation and little head. nice bourony chocolate and roasted malt aroma. the flavor is extremely smooth with touches of caramel blended with the chocolate and roasted malts. the bourbon is an after thought almost. very subtle very good and very delicious.

From Paul. Thanks!

A: Dark mahogany to the point of blackness. Lathery mocha head that disappears. Good legs.

N: Big bourbon, vanilla, and caramel. Toffee. Some melon. Brown sugar.

T: Bourbon integrated into a softly sweet base. Hop bitterness around the edges. Alcohol is noticeable.

M: Crystallized and sticky. Gets a little watery.

O: Well done. A touch more body and this would be a real stunner. Doesnt try to murder by flavor and doesnt kill with sweetness.

2013 vintage. 
Aroma has a nice dark chocolate character with some light roast. Medium light roast character with moderate bourbon and light oak notes. Medium dark fruit with prune, plum and raisin. Some toffee and caramel notes. 
Pours dark brown but not quite black with a small, thick mocha head that recedes fairly steadily to the edges where it lingers slightly. 
Flavor has a nice strong dark chocolate note with light roast and moderately strong bourbon character. Some dark fruit notes of plum and prune with some raisin character. Medium bitterness. Light caramel and moderate toffee. Some medium light alcohol spice in the finish. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium low carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a pretty enjoyable beer. The malt character is not as complex as it could be, but the bourbon character is super well integrated with malt and works really well. Nice bourbon character with some decent dark fruit notes.

Bottle from BottleWorks, Seattle. Pours a rich, dark, opaque brown, just the slightest amount of brown head. Aroma has a punchy sweet essence, lots of vanilla, more booze as beer warms. Body rich, thick, with lingering booze notes. Very nice.

Pours a dark brown with a fast diminishing head that still manage to leave some light lacing. Youre left with a virtually headless brew in 10 seconds, though. Aroma is quite nice with chocolate and vanilla covered in bourbon. Taste is sweet with molasse, caramel and chocolate flavors. Alcohol is a bit hot, body is full. This is a nice sipper with its low to medium carbonation. Not really "english", more like a "by the book" american strong ale. Reminescent of Lost Abbeys Angels Share (the bourbon edition, at least). Nice!

Bottle (22 oz). 2012 vintage. Shared by mathieuc, thanks! Dark brown with a small beige head and little lacing. Aroma is mostly of bourbon along with vanilla, wood, caramel, light spices and light chocolate. Taste is moderately sweet with a lot of bourbon (even after 1+ year), vanilla, caramel, spices, chocolate and light tobacco. Medium to full body. Low to moderate carbonation. Somewhat oily mouthfeel. Good English Strong Ale. A tad too heavy on bourbon, which doesnt help the complexity/balance/drinkability of the beer. Good.

bottle shared by mathieuc, thanks bro. pours very dark brown, red hue, with a small light beige cap, some retention. loads of bourbon oak, coconut, vanilla, sweet yet complex caramel layers, nuttiness, maple, lactose, chocolate, tobacco, chalk. low carbonation, medium to full body - oily and sticky, grassy-spicy-chalky doughy cloying finish. ASA feeling. clean yeast and/or no english character and/or simply overshadowed by barrel treatment. sort of blah.

Vintage 2012

Pours dark brown on black with a slight etching of light mocha foam. Smells fucking awesome, bourbon, vanilla, nougat, caramel, vitamins and minerals, some marshmallow cream and a little bit of burnt cream. Taste follows suite - vanilla, nougat, marshmallow, chocolate, bourbon, oak, smooth malts with a touch of alcohol. Really decadent. Full bodied with limited carb and a fantastically long and mouth watering finish. Im really, really impressed with this beer. Wow. Nice.

Serving type: bottle

12-23-2012

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2013 13

Pours black, red on edges, minimal tannish head.

Smell big whisky oaky vanilla, red fruit, barrel forward, sweet.

Taste big woody, fruity, bourbon. Bit of alcohol heat, lots of vanilla and coconut, light winter spices. 

Medium to fuller bodied.

This is a great beer from a great brewery.

My favorite Washington Beer. This strong ale is an absolute beast. Pours as thick as a stout with a delicious balance of bourbon flavors. Warning, it is heavy on the bourbon flavor. If you like yours on the more subtle side then this may not be the one for you.
Bottle. This is a heft ESA with lots of bourbon flavor to go around. A nice brew if you can get it.

label, frankly, angers me .. . pours out brown .. like you know, brown .. . foam head was low .. . lacing was ray butt .. . bourbon presence was easy, the flavour was abominable .. . decent but nothing id hide in the woods and eat people over..

Taster from a bottle shared at Natifest 2013. Dark brown, but clear color. Minimal light brown head. Couple loose bits of lace. Awesome big bourbon aroma. Dark chocolate, light tannin, light spice. Bigger body. Light chewiness. Very light carbonation. Dry finish. Bigger bitter taste. Very nice barrel influence, here. Nice, big bourbon barrel aged beer.

2013 Bottle shared by some sweet soul at Natifest. The bourbon barrel is subtle, really highlighting the awesome beer. Strong chocolate, vanilla stands out, but there is a nuttiness and some coffee too. This may have been the beer of Natifest 2013 for me.
2013 bottle. Pours a dark brown with a thin, beige head. The aroma is nutty and molasses. Tastes sweet and toasty. Sticky mouthfeel.
sampled at NatiFest 2013 - big body with sweet and sour taste. nice wood flavors. solid.

22 oz. bottle shared by either dudeabide or b3shine (notes from 6/2012). Pours a very dark brown color with a medium sized beige head that left some spotty lace. The aroma has caramel, molasses, hints of cherry and dark fruits, vanilla, bourbon, wood, and some alcohol heat. The flavor again has quite a bit of sweet caramel, bourbon, vanilla, cherry and additional dark fruits, molasses and wood. Viscous mouth feel. Enjoyable.
Bottle. Pours black with no head. Boozy aroma. Taste is sweet molasses and vanilla.

22 oz bottle, 2012. What a nice extra. Black with a crema head. Intense aroma of bourbon, dates, soy, chocolate and caramel. A sharp tang then a brief shudder as the alcohol hits. Taste is bourbon, raisin, fig, molasses and spice with lingering oak. A big brew; could use some mellowing.

Bottle shared at Richards Graduation Party (Western Springs, IL). Thanks, guys! Pours a deeper blackish pour, some good thickness, mellow legs. Some brownish glow in the body, edges. Good haziness, frothy tannish head. Dies to a small ring, laces small. Aromas are toasty, carmelized and a gentle cocoa. A bit older, firmer oak, some vanilla, some tannic barrel and gentle dark fruit. Some cocoa, firmer whiskey comes in as it warms. Initial is medium bodied, a bit thicker, some firmer barrel presence. Firmer barrel leads into some heated ABV on the palate, some roasty and cocoa elements, toffee and toast, gentle dark fruit, spice, more cocoa. A firm barrel presence in the middle, touch of thickness but not too much in body. Backend is a bit more toasty, biscuits and caramel, some vanilla, gentle toasted coconut feel. Gentle dark and dried fruit, firmer whiskey, barrel and vanilla. A bit of toffee, toast. Firm barrel. Pretty solid one, with some interesting dark fruit jabs.
Thanks to Julian for this one! Nice big reddish brown pour, tan head.  Loads of bourbon, vanilla, brown sugar, prunes, raisins, light sherry notes.  Yeah this is big and boozy and I love it.

Wow, this is surprisingly awesome! The beer pours unclear dark chestnut brown, almost black, with a decent dark beige head. The aroma is so delicious, bringing vanilla, big bourbon, spices, and some brown sugar. The flavor brings sweet vanilla, brown sugar, some molasses, and tobacco. The blend is big and so nice.
Always great.  Perfectly balanced malt, barrel character, alcohol, bitterness, and roast.  Huge aroma of vanilla, dark fruit, and caramel.

Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours black with a small, creamy, khaki head. Good retention. The bouquet is malty and vinous - loaded with purple grapes, dried fuzzy and dark fruits, and a nice chocolate/brownie characteristic. Full-bodied with a silky mouthfeel and tickling carbonation. The flavor is bittersweet, deeply roasted and chocolaty with heaps of dried dark fruits that carry right on through to the  chocolaty, carbonic conclusion. Huge thanks to newcigarz for providing this world class beer!

22oz bottle, 2012 vintage, courtesy of a friend. Thanks, Chris! Pours a murky, oily dark-brown color with a good bit of viscosity; thin perimeter of medium-tan bubbles. Generous, beautifully layered aroma on this: caramel, toffee, dates, and other dried fruits; well-placed oxidation and a barrel character thats seamlessly attached: lush bourbon, light vanilla and spice, and a vinous heat throughout. Full body, with a modest (but lively and tiny-bubbled) carbonation that gives this a very pleasant texture in the mouth. Caramel, dried fruits, and a perfectly integrated bourbon-barrel character that follows the aroma notes: lush, seamless, with loads of lightly oxidized, caramel-driven goodness; this is a damn fine beer. Long finish of caramel, soft bourbon, and a touch of wood.

2010 rating - thanks jedwards! Pours a slightly hazy reddish brown with a mild light brown head. Smell is rich caramel and toasted malt. Taste is rich buttery caramel, dark fruit, bourbon, slightly dry at the end. Medium body with fine carbonation. Tasty stuff.

24th January 2013 THE Others tasting. Thanks to Bruce again! Opaque black - brown beer. Tidy pale tan head. Palate is soft and a little dry. Very moderate carbonation. Rich dark malt, dark toffee, Dark chocolate and rich spicy bourbon, well integrated. Semi dry finish. Rich and tasty dark beer.

Bottle generously shared by my man Tony C.  Dark brown/black pour with a small tan head.  Muted bourbon aromas.  Rich and silky smooth with rich caramel, dark roasted malt and velvety bourbon notes.  Under currents of oak and vanilla round out the hand.  A real stunner.  Thanks Tony....

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2014 Bomber from trade with michaelinwa.  Pours a nice dark black color with a small head that fades quickly.  Very nice bourbon aroma mixed with vanilla, wood, caramel, chocolate and spices.  Excellent taste.  Bourbon flavor is forward but there are nice barrel notes of wood and vanilla.  A nice chocolate and spice flavor comes through in the finish.  Light alcohol burn, fairly thick and sticky mouthfeel, Love this beer.  I love that the base beer seems to come through very well.  Very impressed.

Bottle @ THE Others Tasting. Cheers to Bruce for bringing this along! The pours deep, murky brown with a small head. The nose is rich toffee, spiced fruit cake, chocolate gateau. Berry and orange peel squash. Hints of raisin and runny toffee. Complex, big nose. The taste is more hot raisin cake. Some vanilla-coated pancake. Rich, roasted chocolate malts, brown bread toast. Complex, full flavors. Big, fat body. Fine carbonation. Overall, a pretty stellar beer that reveals new things with every sip. Hopefully Ill get to try this again.

Winter 2012 release. Nose holds slightly dry yeast, spices, roasted caramel malt,  bourbon. Needs more body. Taste shows an exceptionally smooth blend of these ingredients, pulling the spice character back in favor of stronger base & bourbon notes. The barrel remains quite nicely rounded throughout, a feat which precious few brews achieve. Impressive.

Bottle at THE others tasting, thanks to Bruce. It pours near black with a small light tan head. The nose is roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, toasted coconut, brown sugar, marshmallow and spice. The taste is wood, roasted malt, Xmas spice, toast, earth, dark fruit, raisin, cocoa powder, toasted coconut and some alcohol warmth. Full body and moderate carbonation. Rich, flavoursome and well balanced. Delicious!

Bottle at The Others Tasting, London - tremendous thanks to Bruce for sharing what happened to be one of my top wants! Pours dark brown with a creamy, beige foam head. Rich, sugary dark bread nose, brown sugar, dark fruits. Medium to big sweet flavor, dark fruits, raisins, plums, lightly torched wood, moderate earthy bitternesss, dark leathery berries, faint roast. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Warm finish with rich grapes, dry raisins, toffee and brown sugar, faint cocoa. Rich and delicious. Well balanced, too, I would say. Excellent stuff.

Bottle from waltersrj. Aroma of vanilla-malt, bourbon bomb. Flavors were smooth with a complimentary bourbon note. Drank alongside Arctic Devil, and surprisingly, it was slightly better...less burn. Hard to argue with the B-Bomb. This is one excellent beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 oz. bottle, 2012 vintage- Pours totally black with a thin mocha colored head that reduces to a collar. Aroma is bourbon, oak up the ass, caramel malt. The taste is so delicious, perfect word, absolutely delicious, there is oak again, caramel, less bourbon, vanilla, cocoa. Body is pretty full, but not overbearing, carbonation is soft and somewhat low. Overall massively impressed, better than even expected, and for the price and reputation, I had high expectations!

Waxed 22 oz. bottle served FFF teku glass. 2012 vintage. Big thanks to mfavoino for sharing this guy.

A: Pours a dark blackish color with some semi-clear brown edges. A tan head forms on the pour and recedes quickly to a thin ring. Some splotches of lace are left behind.

S: Some light all spice and nutmeg. Dark fruits and very smooth bourbon. Sweet malts with some light barrel oak.

T: Toffee sweetness with some bourbon and light roasted malts. A little chocolate, some light all spice and a finish of caramel with more bourbon. 

M: Medium to heavy bodied with some medium to low carb. Some residual sugar sweetness as well leaving a little sweetness that coats the teeth.

O: This was very delicious. The spices still came through while the barrel really shined. Id love to lay one down and see what some age does to it.

Serving type: bottle

Bottle from CoOp Bellingham, vintage 2011, 9.5% ABVDark brown color, almost black, with very small head. The aroma is bi-dimensional but very effective: vanilla oak and chocolate; penetrating. Its full bodied, and the texture is partially oily, also because of the relatively low carbonation; good flavor of dark chocolate and caramel, quite sweet, with some random vanilla and a very light sour note from the darker malts; the bitterness is just right; in the final there is a touch of sweet liquorice, and a boozy kick.Very good, but the flavor could be more elegant.

Bottle courtesy of Max at Andys New Years Par-tay! Pours a clear brown with a thin white head.  Big spicy chocolate with a touch of a bitter cocoa and roast, long hot bourbon.  Medium bodied, warm bourbon and vanilla, not as hot as the nose suggests.  Vanilla and bourbon, very faint and light touches of wood.  Cocoa, roast, chocolate. Long warm bourbon into the finish.  Rather tasty.

pours a black with a small brown head, and some lacing.

smell is of cocoa, dark fruit, bourbon, some spice, a few hops, and dark malt.

taste is smooth, milk chocolate, bourbon, some dark fruits, malt, and some hops.  ends smooth.

Waxed dipped bomber. 2012 release. 11% ABV. Thanks for the Christmas gift, brenn79! Pours opaque black with a medium tan head with good retention. Aroma is oaky, bourbon, raisins, caramel, molasses, vanilla, dough--delicious. Taste is sweet with a slight bitter finish. Licorice, caramel flavors abound. A little too lowly carbonated for me; has an oily texture. Awesome beer, even with the palate flaw.

Courtesy of 5000 via trade
Bottle:  The aroma consists of chocolate, caramel, molasses, bourbon, coconut, vanilla, and faint alcohol.  It pours a dark brown with no transparency and a small tan head that quickly fades to a thin ring around the edges of the glass.  There is minimal spotty lacing. The flavor starts with chocolate, caramel, and molasses,  The finish has moderate bourbon, light alcohol, and some coconut.
Bottle purchased from Bottleworks. Big bold bourbon flavor and nose with a nice malt body underlying the barrel character. wood, vanilla, cinnamon, toffee, and nuttiness.

Red Wax Dipped 2012 Vintage Bomber, 11% ABV. Pours a deep dark brown color with a thin circle of mocha foam and bubbles around the glass. The aroma is a blend of bourbon, vanilla, molasses and dark fruits. The flavor starts with strong dark chocolate malt, vanilla and roasted malt notes along with some black cherry, date, caramel and charred oak. The bourbon is naturally present throughout and holds all the rich flavors together nicely. The body is moderately thick and syrupy with soft carbonation and a pleasantly boozy, roast finish. B-BOMB delivers the goods.

Bottle to tulip.  Pours dark cola with dark tan head.
Aroma:  Bourbon, oak, toffee, vanilla, chocolate.
Taste:  Sweet start, bourbon and vanilla up front, followed by a rich chocolate finish.
Palate:  Smooth.  Moderate carbonation, great lingering finish.  Given how sweet this is I was expecting it to feel sticky, but it was really just about perfect.
Overall:  Very nice.  Almost completely transformed from the A Bomb.  Ill be picking up a few more bottles of this before theyre out for the year.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a very deep brown, almost black colored body with a touch of a reddish hue. Finger-width, dense and creamy, brown head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is rich and malty with lots of coconut, chocolate, toffee, and light roasts with a solid bourbon, vanilla, and light wood backing. Just a touch of cherry in there as well. Flavor is similar. Coconut and chocolate up front with a lightly sweetened toffee, light roasts, and touch of cherry. Balanced vanilla and bourbon lead this into the end with a light wood. Finishes rich and smooth with a nice chocolate note and a light roasty dryness alongside some vanilla and bourbon. Lengthy aftertaste following a smooth, soft, medium-full body and a creamy, very soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, a really well done barrel aged beer. The body has held up well and is very soft and creamy and the bourbon and vanilla balance the rich malts nicely while adding a good amount of coconut. Delicious beer and one of my favorites thus far on my Seattle trip.

651mL red wax thanks to Emily! Pours clear deep sepia to black with a small, coffee head. Spotty lace. Richer butter and tomato paste nose with cinnamon and dark chocolate mousse. Palate is hot, spicy, lots of cracked pepper. Nice. Thick, spicy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2011, red waxed bottle, via trade. pours a deep, dark, chestnut brown (like a good winter ale should) with a creamy, light khaki head that has excellent retention. aroma is wonderful with big notes of candied nuts, pralines, coconut, and vanilla cake backed by subtle cocoa, toasted oak, bourbon, and dark fruits. flavor is delicious as well with smooth, rich bourbon, vanilla, oak, and dark malts up front backed by pralines, black cherries, walnuts, and earthy hops. palate is full bodied with smooth carbonation and a lingering, sweet, woody finish. overall, a great barrel aged winter ale.
Thanks a ton to Ben for this one.  Really rich nutty roasty flavors with a great barrel character.  Notes of chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts, and light spicyness.  Fantastic and unique beer.
yea this is awesome, very rich and roasty, perfect blend of bourbon flavoring, love it
Brought this bottle from WA to drink in Belgium... Very rich, nice spices - everyone liked it...

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, big thanks to Aaron for the pour! Thick dark brownish black with thin to no off white head, aroma has notes of big dark chocolate, coconut, vanilla, some hints of bourbon, slight retronasal burn, hints of roast and coffee notes, touch of molasses.  Taste is a mix of vanilla, coconut, touch of roast, nice molasses, caramel, hints of bourbon, nice dark fruits, finishing fairly sweet, slightly roasty.  Pretty nice stuff.

Bottle @ Stephens house, courtesy of azurescens. Thanks! Deep brown appearance with a dark brown head. Bourbon, coconut, chocolate, caramel, rich toffee, delicious aroma. Delicious caramel, toffee, very smooth bourbon, vanilla, coconut, chocolate flavor with an ever slight sourness on the finish. Delicious German Chocolate cake beer!

Bottle at home shared with friends, courtesy of Aaron. Thanks Man!! Poured pitch black with a small tan head and decent lacing. Smell is big coconut, wood, vanilla, cocoa nibs, roasted caramel, and brown sugar. Taste is candi sugar, coconut, dark chocolate, oak, bourbon, and light spice. Mouthfeel is sticky with soft carbonation. Very sweet, but smooth and creamy, pretty easy drinking with well-hidden alcohol. Nice!

Bottle. Pour is dark with a little head. The aroma is strong bourbon for the most part with some nice dark fruit notes. The taste is milder than the smell. Good smooth flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared by b3shine. Poured clear dark brown color with large light brown frothy head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Medium to heavy toasted chocolate malt, vanilla wood and cherry bourbon aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted malt bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Good interesting complex brew.
Bottle to snifter. Looks pretty good; pitch black with low carbonation and thin lacing. Smells good too; boozy. Tastes pretty good; a nice winter warmer. Good on the palate too. Solid.

On tap @ Super Deli Mart. Pours dark caramel brown with a thin oily head. Aroma is a little cocoa and strong bourbon. Taste is boozy - roasted malts, licorice, toffee, some chocolate, and oh by the way - bourbon!  Mouthfeel is thick and sticky. This is delicious. Lacks the complexity of some other barrel-aged favorites, and extraordinarily overpriced at $20+ for a 22oz bottle, but nonetheless a treat.

Bottle...  Poured dark brownish with a thin, light beige head.  Nose of oak and whiskey with vanilla and malt.  Insane amount of vanilla here.  Just delicious.  Big booze-like tones, whiskey, dark sticky caramel.  Vanilla all over, dark fruits and some esters.  Dense cake batter, malt and smooth finish.  Didnt pick up hops but this didnt need any of that.
Tastes delicious, like stuff i like to put in my mouth. Makes me feel warm and happy, like a hug.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2013 Pours black, with fairly low head that disappears quickly. Carbonation is soft. Aroma is raisins, berries, wine, alcohol, soy, sweet malt. Leans a bit to the sweet side, less so when colder, and maybe a bit too much when warm. Its complex but somewhat mellow, with bourbon, raisin, wine, and chocolate. A little boozey, but it works for me. Mouthfeel is slightly thick and oily, but not heavy. Its different, interesting, tasty, and very easy to drink. Very pricey, but worth a couple bottles every year because its so different. Loses barrel notes and some depth when aged, so not good for the cellar beyond 6 months or so. Update: tasting of 2012 bottle, on 611/13. Really holding up well in cellar; flavor notes above are all spot on. Barrel notes are strong. Flavor is light but rich and complex. Really a fantastic beer. Like this better than Stone Russian or FW Parabola when fresh. This is in Kuhnhenn BA4D for me.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2012 22 oz. bottle shared by foppa78- thanks again, Mat! 2010 vintage. Pours a hazy brownish plum-amber color with a small off-white head. Big barrel notes in this one. Bourbon, oak, caramel, vanilla, chocolate, mild spice, coconut, toasted sugar- sweet and malty. Medium-bodied, smooth, with low carbonation. Tasty. Re-Rate: 8/7/12. 2011 bottle shared by bsuedekum- thanks, Blake! It seemed to hit all the same notes as the 2010 did for me (with an admittedly DLD-worn palate) but didnt have the same pop. Id still call it a really nice bourbon barrel winter ale, though.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2012 Holy B Bomb, Batman!

I dont know when I was last this incredibly surprised by an ale.

Deep ruby brown pour with black highlights.

Head is two fingers of tan, dense foam that subsides to form a lasting ring. Lacing is minimal, but decent.

The nose (and flavor) are bourbon, bourbon, and more bourbon with underpinnings of dark chocolate, toffee, caramel brown and red fruits almost too numerous to list (date, fig, kumquat, plum, breadfruit, starfruit, mandarin orange/tangerine, pineapple, just to name a few). There is also plenty of old leather, tobacco, coconut, pecan praline, honey, sherry, brandy a hint of smoke, cinnamon, cardamom, and coriander, and even a touch of something like lavender. 

This beer reminds me of a cross between Firestone Walkers Fifteen and Parabola, except its richer, and more intense in flavor than either of those, despite being three percent lower in alcohol! This beer may not be as subtle as some, but its one of the most complex, dynamic brews of any style that Ive tasted.

This is definitely the ultimate sipping beer, and would pair marvelously with the stoutest cigar.

Major Kudos to Fremont Brewing for creating that rarest of beers worthy of being called an instant classic.

22oz bottle.
Deep red pour with some eggshell colored head.  Nose is decadent - chocolate, oak, vanilla, and bourbon.  Flavor is just as good - chocolate and roast, vanilla, brown sugar sweetness, bourbon.  Great beer.

Bottle 22fl.oz.ABV: 9.5%. Clear dark dark brown colour with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, wood, alcohol - bourbon. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, vanilla, licorice, dark malt, alcohol, bourbon. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120320]

Deep, dark brown almost stout/porter appearance. Bourbon and maple nose. Full bodied and extremely rich. The bourbon, roasted nuts and vanilla take turns washing over the palate. Nothing subtle here, but delicious!
Good balance good flavor deep. Really tasty. Roasty malt chocolate flavor cocoa texture. A little not of dark fruit. Comple and tasty.

Bottle @ yespr. Pours a dark brown almost black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty bourbon barrel chocolate aroma with hints of vanilla. Sweetish malty bourbon and vanilla flavor with chocolate and toffee hints. Has a sweetish malty bourbon and vanilla finish.

Bomber from Malt & Vine. Pours dark brown with a creamy/bubbly dark tan head. Aromas of chocolate, oak, bourbon/vanilla and something else thats familiar, but I cant pin it down. Full bodied.  Flavor is very mixed chocolate/bourbon/vanilla with a fair amount of astringent oak. Theres  noticeable heat, but its not annoying. Overall I can see why this might be referred to as spicy. Perhaps a little peppery. Theres a lot going on here.

Bottle at yespr.
Clear dark brown coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of dark chocolate, caramel and dried fruits.
Roasted flavour of hops and dark chocolate.
Roasted and hoppy finish.

pitch dark, small light brown head.
very peaty and very roasted ,malty aroma. wood. quite extreme aroma. slightly spicy.sweet  flavor is very sweet and loads of bourbon.

Bottled. A pitch black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, bourbon, and caramel. The flavor alcohol, bourbon, roasted malt, and chocolate, leading to a bourbon, alcoholic, and roasted finish.

Bottle, 66 cl. Black with small beige head. Plummy, lightly alcoholic aroma with notes notes of caramel, dark fruits, dark roasted malts, brown sugar, licorice, wood. Flavor is very rich and dark fruity, complex and sweet with a medium bitter finish and bourbon notes. Thick texture, soft carbonation, delicious.

22 fl oz bottle. Pours hazy dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is smooth roasted malty, light fruity and mixed caramelish and vanilla. Smooth roasted malty and caramelish, dark malty and minerals. Chocolate and minerally dark roasted finish.

Bottle at yespr. Pours very dark brown with a medium light tan head. The aroma is vanilla, roasted malt, sweet dark fruit and tobacco. The flavour is loads of bourbon, sweet ripe fruit, roasted malt, oak, toasted caramel and tobacco. Very nice.

Bottle 65 cl. Courtesy of yespr/Ungstrup. Vintage 2011. Pours an opaque black with a tiny beige head. Thick and sweet Bourbon dominates the aroma overpowering the roastiness. Medium body, sweet vanilla and thick, thick oak dominates the flavour, heavy roast and licorice underneath. Bitter finish from both roast and hops. 200312

Thanks to thirdeye11 for sharing this bottle.

The beer pours a deep red color with an off-white head. The aroma has a ton of bourbon and wood notes, as well as some oak, maple and caramel. The beer smells amazing and has all the notes you want in a bourbon barrel aged beer. 

The flavor is just as good as the aroma. I get a lot of chocolate and some light roasted malt notes, as well as some nice bourbon, maple and vanilla. There is also a nice oak undertone in the flavor. 

Thick mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Black, brown edges, thin head. Aroma of bourbon and malts, molasses, dark fruit, sweet tobacco leaf, vanilla, licorice, earthy. Taste is awesome, lots of bourbon, but not hot, very silky texture with very little carbonation. It coats the entirety of the mouth but is not sticky sweet.

11 bottle from the always generous John - thanks!  Pours an exceptionally dark brown with a slick of tan foam.  Aroma is semi-hot bourbon with some vanilla, subtle coconut, toffee, cola, and perhaps some sweet, toasted malt buried under the bourbon.  Taste is dominated by the bourbon which presents as initially a bit hot before opening up with some nice vanilla and coconut.  The middle of the taste consists of the sweet, toasted malt and toffee character of the base beer with some light bitter hops and raisin accents before the bourbon reappears and runs through the finish with some light alcohol heat. Mouthfeel is even and coating.  I really enjoyed this beer.

Sampled at the 12 GABBF.  Dark beer with only the smallest glint of ruby when held against the light.  Tan slick for a head.  Big bourbon barrel nose.  This beer is really dominated by the bourbon.  boozy alcohol that almost burns when you breath after drinking it.  Some caramel sweetness and a little fruitiness, but it is all just so dominated by the bourbon.  I like it when the barrel aged beers are better balanced.  Still, if you like bourbon you will like this.

The pour is dark brown in color with a small khaki head.  The aroma starts off with lots of roast and a bit of coffee.  Bourbon is there, but not very strong.  Theres more oak than bourbon.  Some toffee sweetness with a bit of dark chocolate.  Again, not much bourbon flavor, but there is some oak and vanilla.  A bit of roast and coffee with a fair amount of dark chocolate.  Moderate sweetness of caramel and toffee.  Actually sort of mellow.
Draft at GABBF. Golden brown color, thin white head. Aroma of pure whiskey. Taste is similar. Whiskey overwhelms the beer.

22 oz. bottle from the PCC in Fremont. I got hooked up on this one. Could have bought it weeks ago, but I decided not to, considering, the hefty price-tag. Head around the circumference of the glass. Lots of vanilla, wood, and bourbon. Wow, this this is pungent, and its smellin pretty, pretty, pretty, pretty good. Bits of graham cracker poke through, as well. Lovely aroma, and color. All bourbon both forwards and backwards. This thing is fucking hot, but on a night like tonight, I need something this hot. Damn this is a mouth warmer. Very, very boozy. Its out of control boozy.Bits of the vanilla, come through but the hot bourbon just rolls in and doesnt leave much Very good stuff, and very much needed on a cold Seattle night, such as this. Texture is thin, and deep molasses and caramel richness are left at the back of your throat. This develop s some, but not much $17.50 for a bottle. Great stuff from Fremont. Fremont Brewing Co., this is what you should normally brew, but on a larger, and cheaper scale. If you do, Ill start buying your beer on a regular basis.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2014 22 oz wax sealed bottle.  Pours a very dark coffee brown with small tan head.  Aroma of bourbon overpowers anything else.  Flavor is rich with plentiful amounts of vanilla, bourbon, and roasted brown sugar.  Its pretty strong at 9.5% ABV, and you an taste it in the finish with a bourbony bite.  I think this is the sort of beer that my dad would say will "grow hair on your chest."  Glad they decided to bottle it this year, and if you got your hands on one, count yourself among the lucky.

On tap at Brouwers for Big Wood, pours a near-black with a tiny ring of tan head. Aroma of light bourbon, vanilla, with little else. Flavour of vanilla and bourbon, overtaking the base beer but with great results. Waaay better than the original beer. Stunning complexity to this.

(22oz bottle, courtesy of thirdeye11)  Pours a deep amber body with a small beige head.  Aroma of caramel, bourbon, vanilla, wood, and toasted coconut.  Flavor of caramel, vanilla, roasted malt, nuts, coconut, and wood with a dry finish.

2010 edition. Pours a deep dark brown color with a small white head. A massive bourbon nose with some heat. The flavor is similarly a bourbon beast with vanilla, wood, some roast, sweet berries and a very dry palate. I actually get a  good bit of English Strong Ale here with sweet fruity malts and some yeast. Very nice, a nightcap.

Bottle at a BA/RB "beer camping" excursion in the Oregon Cascade foothills in June 2011. Colour... dark brown with a thick head. Nose... booze and medjool dates.
